title: Looking for the origin of stencil square sans digitized as Hemi Head (Larabie Fonts)
content:
Hey everyone, I’m trying to ID this font. It’s been around since at least the 1960s, and it does exist digitally. Any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224165913im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Mystery_Stencil_type_4861.jpg)

 [‹ (x) 2 straight-sided tech sans - Klavika, Apex New {Thomas Binder, Tomi K}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224165913/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40283 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Handwritten script on Passport Health website - Handwriting {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224165913/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40268 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Hemi_Charger

comments.content:
This is [Hemi Head](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224165913/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/hemi-head-426/) from Ray Larabie, which exists digitally, but is not as old as you think.

- Lex

Lex, thanks for the info.  
Check out the Dodge logo in this 1967 ad.  
I’m still trying to learn of the font’s original name / foundry / year of release.  
Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224165913im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Dodge_6668.jpg)
